moves.1. e4: In this game I was down but didnt give up and delivered checkmate.  I start off with the modern defense.
moves.1... g6 2. d4 d6 3. Bg5 Bg7 4. Bc4: White violates the principle knights before bishops
moves.4... Nf6 5. Nc3 c6: to keep white from advancing his d-pawn
moves.7. Qd2 Bg4: I attack his knight to threaten to ruin his kingside but he can easily defend with Be2.  He castles long instead
moves.8. O-O-O b5: I immediately start a queenside attack
moves.9. Be2: He doesnt want doubled up pawns.
moves.9... a5: I continue with my Queenside attack.
moves.11. Bxg7 Kxg7: Im in no danger here with this exchange.
moves.12. e5 dxe5 13. Nxe5: Notice I leave my c6 pawn exposed
moves.13... Bxe2: I take his bishop with initiative and attack his rook
moves.15. Nxc6: didnt really think out that combination
moves.15... Qc7: I attack his knight and most importantly get her majesty on the c-file in line with the white king
moves.16. Qf3: He should have took e7 but he overlooked this
moves.17. Nxb5: I am down two points and he is now attacking my Queen, I chose to attack back with Qb6
moves.17... Qb6 18. Nc3: My Queen is still on a good file
moves.18... e6: I move this pawn to give my rook flexibility.
moves.20. b3: Now white has blocked the b-file for my Queen.
moves.21. Ne5 Qc7: double attacking the knight and indirectly threatening mate
moves.22... Nxe5: I make this move to attack the c knight blocking mate
moves.23. dxe5 Nd5: Now im attacking the knight three times and he cannot move the knight or its all over and it is.  He moves the knight and I easily mate him
moves.24. Nxd5 Qxc2#: What could white have done to prevent the loss of his knight?
